citeinfo.title: Continuous Snow Depth, Intensive Site 1, Barrow, Alaska

descript.purpose: These data are being collected to better understand the energy dynamics above the active layer and permafrost. They complement in-situ snow and soil measurements at this location. The data could also be used as supporting measurements for other research and modeling activities.

citeinfo.title: Evaluation of Ultrasonic Snow Depth Sensors for U.S. Snow Measurements

procstep.procdesc: Data is retrieved hourly over local Barrow radio network
Over the course of the winter the data is passively monitored for sensor failure.
At the end of the snow season data is processed.

5 minute distance data is converted to snow depth. Using a data visualization utility in sliding 1 to 2 day increments the data is viewed and outliers / extraneous data noise are removed from the 5 minute stream. Once the entire snow season has been viewed, filtered, and approved as quality data, a one hour and 3 hour moving average is applied. In 2014 an additional parameter was added to the 2013-2014 data set, estimated snow depth. This quantity is highly correlated with the 1 hour moving average but fluctuates less for example, during blowing snow events when the snow sensor is unable to sense the actual snow surface due to snow particles moving at higher velocity etc. This output is sampled hourly resulting in this data set.
